intro: Senecio alfalfalis, commonly known as the alfalfa groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by cylindrical seed heads. Senecio alfalfalis is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
